intro: Pterospermadendron lanceifolium, commonly known as the lanceleaf pterospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers. The plant has simple, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, winged seeds, facilitating wind dispersal. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
